subject: Re: shinsa question

Hi, guys 'n' gals, thought I'd drop in momentarily.  Re the thread on 
papering koshirae, can I solicit some advice on one of my few "attic 
finds"?  The blade has already been papered (sent back to Japan, 
papered hozon, nice old polish Eisho era unokubi zukuri, but tired).  
The koshirae (not sent) has been assessed by One Who Should Know as 
original and correct pre-Meiji, absolutely NSW (Not Screwed With).  
Mostly in excellent condition, no wear or soil to the tsuka ito, 
even.  I would guess that papering the koshirae would be a slam dunk, 
except

1. The saya is dinged up.  Not terribly badly, but far from 
pristine.  It would be a bastard to repair, because in strong light, 
the "black" lacquer is seen to be black with translucent brown 
streaks running through it.

2. The kashira is for correct court wear, i.e., it is black horn, not 
a kinko match for the fuchi (which is signed, though the apparently 
matching tsuba isn't).

3.  Though the tsuba has the hitsu, there are no accessories, and no 
provisions for any in the saya.

Sooooooo, would there be any real point to submitting this to 
shinsa?  It is pre-Meiji original, but no "knock your socks off".  
Just wondering, in case a shinsa shows up again on the US west coast 
in my lifetime!

NC  ;o)
